title: Casual Bunker/Tanker Operator
description:
Company Description
SGS is the world's leading inspection, verification, testing and certification company. We are recognised as the global benchmark for quality and integrity. With more than 89,000 employees, we operate a network of more than 2,600 offices and laboratories around the world.
 
Job Description
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
To provide assistance with bulk tanker discharges, bunkering vessels and terminal duties as requested by the Branch Manager.
 
SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES
 
Completes bunkering tasks on the wharf at various locations to ensure vessels are fueled in accordance with best practice and customer’s expectations
 
Completes all tasks in a manner that is safe to all personnel and the environment
 
Assists with discharging bulk fuel tankers berthed at Port Nelson or other ports as required
 
Undertakes terminal duties, such as, sample taking and testing, weed spraying, valve greasing, tank dipping, hose testing and pipeline test monitoring at branch and client sites as required
 
Works with the Branch Manager to maximise business returns whilst minimising exposure and risk for the company
 
Ensures all activities are carried out with regard to and recognition of Health and Safety requirements and personal safety
 
Undertakes any other reasonable work requests relevant to your position.
 
Completes all SGS NZ Ltd mandated training requirements as required
 
Has confidence handling fuels and lubricants.
 
Will be confident working with fuel transfer pumps, oil transfer pumps, and metered pumps
 
Qualifications
REQUIRED SKILLS
 
Holds a current unrestricted New Zealand Driving License
 
Is confident towing and reversing trailers
 
Good written and verbal communication skills, information seeking, efficiency and organization skills
 
Able to accurately read gauges and record numbers
 
A mechanical aptitude would be an advantage
 
Awareness and commitment to Health & Safety and understanding of H&S practices
 
Computer literacy in Microsoft Office/Excel would be advantageous
 
First Aid Certificate, Forklift License, Load Slinging/Dog-man experience/certificate and Fire Extinguisher certificate would be an advantage
 
Additional Information
Work is undertaken primarily in Nelson and Picton with occasional opportunities to work at other locations in New Zealand
